title: Chelsea winger Christian Pulisic in tears after being substituted in USA’s defeat to Canada
text:
Christian Pulisic was unhappy after being subbed in USA’s defeat to Canada (ESPN2)

Chelsea winger Christian Pulisic was in tears on the bench after he was substituted in USA’s defeat to Canada.

The 21-year-old was brought off after just 60 minutes as the United States were beaten by Canada for the first time in 34 years in their second CONCACAF Nations League match.

After the match, USA manager Gregg Berhalter claimed that Pulisic had been suffering from ‘flu-like symptoms’ and a ‘light fever’.

But with the game at 0-0 when he was brought off, Pulisic was clearly unhappy with Berhalter’s decision.

Christian Pulisic frustrated after coming off against Canada.pic.twitter.com/ulHoYe4tl3 — USMNT Only (@usmntonly) October 16, 2019

Television replays showed Pulisic arguing with Berhalter, while the winger appeared to say: ‘I’m fine.’

Moments after that exchange, Pulisic was seen with his head in his hands and looked to be in tears.

Say what you want, but this was Pulisic’s reaction after the end of the match when Berhalter came over to talk. This #USMNT video says it all. #BerhalterOut pic.twitter.com/6puMUtu4z9 — Devon (@DevBo_88) October 16, 2019

Pulisic now returns to Chelsea where he has been struggling to win a place in Frank Lampard’s side.

The 21-year-old, who joined Chelsea for £58 million from Borussia Dortmund, has played just 10 minutes in his side’s last four Premier League matches.

Pulisic was also dropped from Lampard’s squad for their Champions League win against Lille earlier this month.
